channel.title: Crossfade for morphing oscillators
channel.description:
Hey!
i'm trying to make a patch with morphing oscillators. The approach that I follow its' to take two oscillators that I like and patch to the two ins of the xfade object (the one with the potentiometer) The problem that I have is when I turn the knob for make the crossfafde, once the knob reaches the center, the volume drops.
How can i crossfade two oscillators without a volume drop ?
Cheers

item.title: Crossfade for morphing oscillators
item.dc:creator: @Sputnki Filippo Tamagnini
item.description:
@Sputnki wrote:

you could try phasing one of the oscillators.. maybe is that kind of problem

Read full topic

item.title: Crossfade for morphing oscillators
item.dc:creator: @adnauseam Jordan
item.description:
@adnauseam wrote:

You could try making your own with 2 multiply objects.

You'll need to send an inverted signal to one and you'll likely need some sort of function to adjust the curves of the linear fade.

Read full topic
